questiontext.text:
Given the following graph, write down the equations of the two simultaneous equations and their solution


Â 

Eqn1: y =[[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

Eqn2: y = [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]][[feedback:prt2]]

Solution: \(x = \)[[input:ans31]] [[validation:ans31]], \(y =\)[[input:ans32]] [[validation:ans32]][[feedback:prt3]]

generalfeedback.text:
These two equations are clearly straight lines and therefore both equations must have the form \(y = mx+c\) where \(c\) is the \(y\)-intercept and \(m\) is the gradient. Reading these from the graph gives:

eqn1: \(y={@ta1@}\)

eqn2: \(y = {@ta2@}\).

The solutions to the simultaneous equations are the coordinates of the point of intersection of the two lines. Hence the solution is:

\(x = {@ta31@}\), \(y = {@ta32@}\).
